name: decembrist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who took part in the uprising (= act of opposition, sometimes using violence) against the Russian Tsar (= ruler), Nicholas I, in 1825: His death led to the attempted revolutionary coup of the Decembrists. The insurrection of the Decembrists had insufficient social support.
More examplesFewer examplesThese wooden dwellings were once the homes of exiled Decembrists.The Decembrists who fought to overthrow the Tsar were all wealthy people.The southern Decembrists operated on Ukrainian soil.

relating to the Decembrists: When the Decembrist revolutionaries were banished to Siberia, their wives either went with them, or waited at home. Most of those who took part in the Decembrist uprising were exiled or executed.
More examplesFewer examplesSeveral of the Decembrist conspirators already had some experience of Siberia.Exile prevented him from taking part in the Decembrist revolt of 1825.The Decembrist reformers of 1825 could not gather enough support.
